titleStmt.title: William F. White and C. T. Worley, Bond
CWG5050

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: "BAIL BOND."William F. White being in custody, charged with the offence of Dealing Faro and being admitted to Bail in the sum of Five hundred dollars We, William F White and C T Worley hereby undertake that the above named William F White shall appear before the Judge of the Fayette Circuit Court at the Court house in Lexington on the 1st day of the next June term A. D., 1864, to answer said charge, and shall at all times render himself amenable to the order and process of said Court, in the prosecution of said charge, and if convicted shall render himself in execution thereof, or if he fail to perform either of these conditions, that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the sum of Five hundred Dollars.

ATTEST:
J H Harrison }
W F White
SEAL.
C T Worley
SEAL.

The above named C T Worley this day made oath before me that he is the owners of Visible Property over and above the exempt from execution to the value of Five hundred Dollars, and able to pay and discharge the above Bond after the payment of all just debts and those for which he is legally bound. for.

Sworn to and subscribed before me, this day 14th of March 1864.
J H Harrison D S S.F.C.

C T Worley
SEAL.
SEAL.
A Copy- Att Jno B Norton C f C C
by Chas F Lowry D C
